Config Object.name: initialList
desc: The initialList property is the first list started when the user clicks on the AutoComplete widget.
It's value should be the name of a List Object.
initialList is required when there are more than one List Objects on config.lists.

Config Object.name: initialValue
desc: If provided, sets the initial value of the AutoComplete widget.

Config Object.name: lists
desc: The lists property contains all of the lists used to power the dropdown options.
lists should be an object where the property values are the names of lists, and the values are List Objects.

Config Object.name: maxTokenGroups
desc: The maximum number of Token Groups allowed in the search bar.
Set maxTokenGroups to false to allow unlimited Token Groups.

Config Object.name: onChange
desc: Function to execute when the value of the widget changes.
The first argument to the function is the new value of the widget, the second argument is the old value of the widget.
If this function returns a valid widget value, then that value becomes the value of the widget.  If not, the original new value becomes the value of the widget.

Config Object.name: placeholderHTML
desc: A placeholder to show in the AutoComplete widget when there are no Token Groups.

Config Object.name: showErrors
desc: showErrors is an optional parameter to control how AutoComplete reports errors.
Every error in AutoComplete has a unique code to help diagnose problems and search for solutions.
If showErrors is false then errors will be ignored.
If showErrors is 'console' then errors will be sent to console.log().
If showErrors is 'alert' then errors will be sent to window.alert().
If showErrors is a function then the first argument is the unique error code, the second argument is an error string, and an optional third argument is a data structure that is relevant to the error.

Config Object.name: tokenSeparatorHTML
desc: The HTML string to put between Tokens in the search bar.
If tokenSeparatorHTML is a function the first argument is the Token Object to the left of the separator, the second argument is the Token Object to the right.
The function should return an HTML string.

List Object.name: ajaxErrorHTML
desc: An HTML string to display when an AJAX request has failed.

If ajaxErrorHTML is a function, the first argument is the type of error that has occurred, the second argument is the text that the user has entered, and the third argument is the current value of the AutoComplete widget.
Possible values for the first argument are: 'timeout', 'error', and 'parsererror'. Note: you will never see 'abort', as this is handled internally by AutoComplete.
The function should return an HTML string.

List Object.name: ajaxLoadingHTML
desc: An HTML string to display when searching for options.
If ajaxLoadingHTML is a function, the first argument is the text that the user has entered and the second argument is the current value of the AutoComplete widget.
The function should return an HTML string.

List Object.name: ajaxOpts
desc: Internally, AutoComplete uses the jQuery $.ajax() method to make AJAX requests.
If provided, ajaxOpts will be called with $.extend() against the default settings.
You can override any $.ajax() parameter except: async, complete, error, statusCode, success (ie: parameters that effect control flow)
If ajaxOpts is a function the first argument is the text that the user has typed and the second argument is the current value of the AutoComplete widget.
The function should return an object to pass to $.ajax().

List Object.name: ajaxOpts.preProcess
desc: preProcess is an optional function that will be called after the AJAX request has finished and before the options are shown.
The first argument is the data returned by the server, the second argument is the text that the user has entered, and the third argument is the current value of the AutoComplete widget.
The function should return an array of Option Objects.
preProcess is independent of the jQuery $.ajax() method.

List Object.name: ajaxOpts.url
desc: The url to send an AJAX request to.
The string '{input}' will be replaced with the text the user has typed.
The text will be escaped using encodeURIComponent().
If url is a function, the first argument is the text that the user has typed and the second argument is the current value of the AutoComplete widget.
The function should return a url string.

List Object.name: allowFreeform
desc: If true, allows the user to enter free-form text in the search bar.
If false, the user must select an option from the dropdown list.
There can still be options when allowFreeform is set to true, but the user does not have to select one.

List Object.name: cacheAjax
desc: If true, AutoComplete will cache the results of AJAX calls to localStorage using the url as the key.
If false, it will not cache and send a new AJAX request every time.
Only HTTP GET requests are cached.
If the browser does not support localStorage it will only cache results for the duration of the page.
If you need to support browsers that do not have localStorage I recommend using a polyfill.

List Object.name: cacheAjaxSeconds
desc: Length of time in seconds to keep results in the cache.
Set cacheAjaxSeconds to false to cache results indefinitely.
cacheAjaxSeconds has no effect if cacheAjax is false.

List Object.name: children
desc: children should be the name of a List Object defined on config.lists.
When any option from the list is selected from the dropdown, children is the name of the next list to show in the dropdown.
If there is a children property on the Option Object selected it will supersede this children property.

List Object.name: highlightMatches
desc: If true, AutoComplete will highlight letter matches between what the user has typed and which options have matched.
This option programmatically changes the optionHTML value by adding <strong> tags around matching characters.
It tries to not replace letters that are inside HTML tags or special HTML characters, but if you have complicated or invalid HTML markup in your optionHTML it may not highlight correctly.
highlightMatches is independent of the matching algorithm used.

List Object.name: matchOptions
desc: matchOptions is an optional function you can include to determine which options get shown in the dropdown when the user is typing.

The first argument to the function is the text that the user has entered, the second argument are the Option Objects matched by the default algorithm, the third argument is an array of all Option Objects for the current list, and the fourth argument is the current value of the AutoComplete widget.
The function should return an array of Option Objects.
You can return an array of any Option Objects from this function. They do not have to come from the existing Option Objects in the list.
This function gets executed with every 'keydown' event on the input element so it's in your best interest to make this function as fast as possible.

List Object.name: noResultsHTML
desc: An HTML string to display when there are no options to show.
If noResultsHTML is a function, the first argument is the text that the user has entered and the second argument is the current value of the AutoComplete widget.
The function should return an HTML string.
noResultsHTML will never be shown when allowFreeform is true.

List Object.name: optionHTML
desc: If optionHTML is a string, option value properties inside curly braces will be replaced with HTML-escaped values.
If optionHTML is a function the first argument is the option.
The function should return an HTML string.
If there is an optionHTML property on the Option Object selected it will supersede this optionHTML property.

List Object.name: tokenHTML
desc: If tokenHTML is a string, option value properties inside curly braces will be replaced with HTML-escaped values.
If tokenHTML is a function the first argument is the option.
The function should return an HTML string.
If there is a tokenHTML property on the option selected it will supersede this tokenHTML property.

List Object.name: options
desc: options is an array of Option Objects that determine which options to show in the dropdown for this list.

Option Object.name: children
desc: children should be the name of a List Object defined on config.lists.
When any option from the list is selected from the dropdown, children is the name of the next list to show in the dropdown.
If children is false, the list workflow stops when the option is selected.
This children property will supersede a children property on the parent List Object.

Option Object.name: optionHTML
desc: An HTML string to show inside the dropdown.
This optionHTML property will supersede an optionHTML property on the parent list.
If there is no optionHTML on the option and there is no optionHTML on the parent list and value is a string, then optionHTML gets an HTML-escaped value.

Option Object.name: tokenHTML
desc: An HTML string to show inside the search bar.
This tokenHTML property will supersede a tokenHTML property on the parent list.
If there is no tokenHTML on the option and there is no tokenHTML on the parent list, then tokenHTML gets the value of optionHTML.

Option Object.name: useOnce
desc: If true, the option will be removed from the list when selected.
If false, the option will remain in the list.
This tokenHTML property will supersede a tokenHTML property on the parent list.
If there is no tokenHTML on the option and there is no tokenHTML on the parent list, then tokenHTML gets the value of optionHTML.

Option Object.name: value
desc: value is what gets saved in the Token Object when the user selects the option from the dropdown list.
value can be anything that is safe to call JSON.stringify() on.

Token Object.name: tokenHTML
desc: tokenHTML is the HTML displayed in the search bar for the token.
It comes from the option.tokenHTML property.

Token Object.name: value
desc: value is any JSON.stringify()-able data structure.
It comes from the option.value property.

Methods.name: addOption(name, option)
args: name of the list to add the option to
Option Object to add to the list
desc: Add an option to a List Object.
Returns true if adding the option was successful.
Returns false otherwise.

Methods.name: clear()
desc: Clear the value of the widget.
Has the same effect as calling setValue([])

Methods.name: destroy()
Methods.desc: Remove the widget from the DOM.

Methods.name: focus()
Methods.desc: Puts the input focus on the widget.

Methods.name: getList(name)
args: name of the list to get
desc: Returns the List Object if it exists.
Returns false if the list does not exist.

Methods.name: getLists()
Methods.desc: Returns an object of all the List Objects.

Methods.name: getValue()
desc: Returns the current value of the widget.
Returns an empty array if the widget has no Token Groups.

Methods.name: list(name)
args: name of the list to get

Methods.name: list(name, list)
args: name of the list to add or update
Methods.desc: Alias of setList(name, list)

Methods.name: pressDown()
desc: Simulates the user pressing the "Down Arrow" key on the input field.
Has no effect if the input field does not have focus.

Methods.name: pressEnter()
desc: Simulates the user pressing the "Enter" key on the input field.
Has no effect if the input field does not have focus.

Methods.name: pressUp()
desc: Simulates the user pressing the "Up Arrow" key on the input field.
Has no effect if the input field does not have focus.

Methods.name: removeList(name)
args: name of the list to remove
desc: Returns true if the list was removed.
Returns false if not.
You cannot remove the initialList.

Methods.name: removeTokenGroup(index)
args: zero-based index of the Token Group to remove
desc: Remove a Token Group by array index.
Returns the updated value of the widget if successful.
Returns false otherwise.

Methods.name: setInput(input)
args: text to set the input element to
desc: Puts text into the input element as if the user had typed it.
Returns true and updates the widget if updating the input was successful.
Returns false otherwise.

Methods.name: setList(name, list)
args: name of the list to add or update
desc: Adds a new list or updates an existing list.
Returns true if adding the list was successful.
Returns false otherwise.

Methods.name: setValue(value)
desc: Returns true and updates the widget if value is valid.
Returns false otherwise.

Errors.desc: Element with id "<id>" does not exist in the DOM.
fix: AutoComplete could not find your element with document.getElementById.
Please note that if you pass a string as the first argument to the AutoComplete() constructor it should be the value of a DOM id, not a CSS selector (ie: "search_bar", not "#search_bar").

Errors.desc: JSON does not exist. Please include a JSON polyfill.
Errors.fix: AutoComplete requires a JSON implementation. Please include a polyfill for older browsers.

Errors.desc: Unable to find a valid version of jQuery. Please include jQuery 1.4.2 or higher on the page.
Errors.fix: AutoComplete requires jQuery version 1.4.2 or higher.

Errors.desc: You must include at least one List Object on lists.
Errors.fix: The lists config is mandatory and must include at least one List Object.

Errors.desc: The first argument to AutoComplete() cannot be an empty string.
Errors.fix: The first argument to the AutoComplete() constructor should be the id of a DOM element or a reference to a single DOM element.

Errors.desc: The first argument to AutoComplete() must be an ID or a single DOM node.
Errors.fix: The first argument to the AutoComplete() constructor should be the id of a DOM element or a reference to a single DOM element.

Errors.desc: You cannot include properties that effect control flow on ajaxOpts: "async", "complete", "error", "statusCode", "success"
fix: You are not allowed to override certain AJAX properties.

Errors.desc: Error in removeList method. List "<listName>" does not exist.
Errors.fix: The list name you provided to the removeList method is not defined on lists.

Errors.desc: Error in removeList method. You cannot remove the initialList "<listName>"
Errors.fix: You are not allowed to remove the initialList.

Errors.desc: The first argument to the removeList method must be a non-empty string.
Errors.fix: The first argument to removeList should be the name of a List Object that is defined on lists.

Errors.desc: The list object for list "<listName>" is invalid.
Errors.fix: The structure of your List Object is invalid.

Errors.desc: You cannot use an empty string for a list name.
Errors.fix: It is valid to use an empty string for an object property name in JavaScript, but this is not allowed by AutoComplete.

Errors.desc: initialList "<listName>" does not exist on the lists object.
Errors.fix: The list you specified on initialList is not defined on lists.

Errors.desc: The list object passed to the setList method is not valid.
Errors.fix: The structure of your List Object is invalid.

Errors.desc: The first argument to the getList method must be a non-empty string.
Errors.fix: The first argument to getList should be the name of a List Object that is defined on lists.

Errors.desc: Could not find a valid value for optionHTML. Resorted to using value property "<propertyName>"
Errors.fix: AutoComplete could not find a valid optionHTML on either the Option Object or the List Object so it resorted to using the first string option.value property it could find.

Errors.desc: Invalid Value returned from your custom onChange function.
Errors.fix: If you specify an onChange function, it must return an array of Token Groups.

Errors.desc: optionHTML function did not return a string.
Errors.fix: If you provide a function for optionHTML it must return an HTML string.

Errors.desc: Error in removeTokenGroup method. Token group index "<tokenGroupIndex>" does not exist.
Errors.fix: You tried to remove a Token Group array index which doesn't exist.

Errors.desc: The first argument to the setInput method must be a string.
Errors.fix: The argument passed to setInput must be a string.

Errors.desc: Error in addOption method. List "<listName>" does not exist.
Errors.fix: The list name you provided to the addOption method is not defined on lists.

Errors.desc: Unable to create HTML string for optionHTML.
fix: This is an internal AutoComplete error that you should never see.
If you see this error please open a GitHub issue.

Errors.desc: Wrong number of arguments passed to list method.
Errors.fix: The list method takes either 1 or 2 arguments.

Errors.desc: Invalid value pass to initialValue.
Errors.fix: The value passed to initialValue must be an array of Token Groups.

Errors.desc: Invalid value passed to the setValue method.
Errors.fix: The value passed to the setValue method must be an array of Token Groups.

Errors.desc: The first argument to the setList method must be a non-empty string.
Errors.fix: The first argument to setList should be the name of a List Object that is defined on lists.

Errors.desc: Invalid option passed to addOption method.
Errors.fix: You must pass a valid Option Object to the addOption method.

Errors.desc: Your tokenSeparatorHTML function did not return a string.
Errors.fix: If you provide a function to tokenSeparatorHTML, it must return a string.

Errors.desc: Could not find optionID "<optionId>".
fix: This is an internal AutoComplete error that you should never see.
If you see this error please open a GitHub issue.

Errors.desc: The first argument to the addOption method must be a non-empty string.
Errors.fix: The list name you provided to the addOption method is not defined on lists.

Errors.desc: AJAX url must be a string. Did you forget to include one on ajaxOpts?
Errors.fix: If you provide a custom function on ajaxOpts.url, it must return a valid URL string.

Errors.desc: Wrong number of arguments passed to val method.
Errors.fix: The val method takes either 0 or 1 arguments.
